intro: Cremolobus bolivianus, commonly known as the Bolivian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Cremolobus bolivianus is often found in regions with high altitudes and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
